revised_title: Neuropsychology of Cognitive Function: Constraints on Orthographic Representation
tldr: This article discusses the biological constraints on orthographic representation and outlines five principles that a psychologically efficient writing system must meet. It explores the interpretation of orthographies, the processes that mediate between the physical signal and the language it expresses, and the different strategies used in reading and writing. The article also examines the impact of neurological disorders on reading and writing abilities.
